title: Assur Archive 35
description: Scattered around House 15 and the adjacent House 15a in eE6IV, excavators found an archive of more than 40 clay tablets. The available datings range from 687 BC to the years shortly before the fall of the city of Assur. The archive, belonging to Šarru-iqbi and others, consists of documents dealing with loans, a purchase document, a document concerning the adoption of a girl, and a fragmentary list.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Pedersén 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 35
